Reviews.Title: “Just What the "Dr." Ordered....”
Reviews.Author: MzLB2011
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa since 1975 - we are regulars and they continue to improve year after year! It is the only Spa we use in Calistoga because when we are there we are not just a number or herded like cattle through the Spa Experience - they really care and work to provide an excellent experience. Our last visit was April 18, 2012, they offered an exceptional internet deal that included a free overnight room! The rooms have been upgraded and the Jacuzzi Room is spacious, and very relaxing. If you have not treated yourself to Golden Haven, you have not been good to yourself!!! Let me also mention, the massage was GREAT! I have a back, neck & shoulders of steel and Steven did an awesome job of relaxing "well-overdue" muscles. One of the many great points of Golden Haven is that as a couple you are together through every step of the treatment - we love it!!! Hopefully I have inspired you to be good to yourself, and make your reservation with Golden Haven ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Mud Bath”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went just for the mud bath and hour massage as we were staying elsewhere. The mud bath was my first and it was wonderful. Feeels like you are floating. While the place may not have had the ambiance of the exlusive spas, the value was excellent, staff friendly and service great . If you book make sure you mention the Internet rate from their site or they will charge you more.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: soundguy2012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Golden Haven for a night including the spa package to celebrate our anniversary, and we had a great experience. The place is quaint and well kept. The room is clean and even had a private sauna in it. The mud bath, mineral springs, and massage at the spa were a perfect combo before heading to the vineyards.

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: stacy b
Reviews.Content: Drove to Calistoga with no reservations... the place i had intended on staying had no vacancy and we ended up at Golden Haven. So glad we did! The mud bath & hour massage afterward was heavenly. The staff was wonderful and friendly and we couldn't have felt more comfortable. We had a jacuzzi room which was perfect - some reviews talk about the smell but it's the sulphur in the natural spring water. A great getaway for some much needed relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Amandaken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to our first overnight spa, we had a wonderful times. We choose to have a couples mud bath, it was so relaxing and the treatment we recieved was great! Our room was very spacious, and it was quite that's what we needed. It was a great time and the price wasn't bad either. We will be going back again, this year. This is our NEW get a way...Amanda Bridgman.....Modesto, California

Reviews.Title: “Came here for the mineral pool and a massage”
Reviews.Author: H M
Reviews.Content: Although I did not stay at this hotel, I was pleased with the service at the day spa. The receptionists were very cordial and accommodating to me as a non-hotel guest, and the massage therapist, Betina, was excellent. I received a blissfully relaxing back massage from her, and was later able to enjoy the mineral pools with my family after the massage was complete. I have been to other hot springs around the world, and the water in the mineral pool did indeed seem like the real thing. I would definitely recommend this spa for its pool and for the quality of its massage therapists.

Reviews.Title: “Opposite of what I expected..”
Reviews.Author: Gladys P
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the first thing that I noticed was the smell it smelled like rotten eggs. The session cost 125 dollars and it included a mud bath, jacuzzi soak, blanket wrap, and massage. The massage lasted 30 minutes. The massage was by far the best part of the entire session. The blanket wrap was a joke being that all we did was get in the middle of the blanket and somebody came in and folded the longer blanket over us, I am under a blanket every night when I sleep and my blankets are much more comfortable so you can imagine how disappointed I was when I realized that literally all it was..was a blanket wrap, we were not given any sandals to walk comfortably through the property. I will certainly not return it is not a good value for the money and the results are mediocre. I do not understand how they can get away with calling this place a spa it has no vanity for people to freshen up after the fact that I have been bathing in mud. Once is going to be more than enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sal515
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were just at Golden Haven Spa this last weekend. Whether it was the front desk staff or Cristian (our spa attendent) the customer service was GREAT. They made us feel like they wanted us there just as much as we wanted to be there. The mud bath was great. My skin still feels great days later. I will be back for sure. And I recommend it to anyone that is in the area. The only thing I would like enjoyed more was if they allowed pets. I normally don't travel without my dog.

Reviews.Title: “An experience worth while”
Reviews.Author: Wendell H
Reviews.Content: While visiting Golden Haven hot springs, my wife and I had a very rewarding experience. The staff and attendants were very cordial and accomodating. I would like to recommend to anyone visiting Calistoga, to stay at this hot springs. The rooms are very clean as well as relaxing. This is our second time there,and we plan to have many more visits.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Deal”
Reviews.Author: frazzle_dazzle47
Reviews.Content: This seems to be the lowest-priced spa in Calistoga. If you don't care about ambiance in the least, it could be ok. However, the front desk staff are minimally friendly and not particularly professional. It is also noisy, and the crowd is a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - this place is a mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: sundari108
Reviews.Content: We read both good and bad reviews of Golden Haven before going. I have to say that the person who wrote the review titled "We thought this was a joke... where's the camera?" gets the prize for writing a review that perfectly summed up our "spa" experience. (If you want a good laugh, read her review). We stayed in one of the jacuzzi rooms, which was actually bit better than I expected (having read many reviews that said the place was really run down). Our room and bathroom were not run down at all - quite the contrary... the room looked like it had been redone within the past couple of years. The "soaker" jacuzzi's in the room are kind of old and a little funky looking, but they were clean and the water is great, and being able to soak whenever you want in your room was a nice luxury (if you can get past the rotting egg / sulphur smell of the mineral water in your room, which some people complained about, but it didn't bother us at all). I would say the room was very "average" considering it's high cost (over $250. a night). Here's the "mixed bag" part -- the "spa" experience. It started off well with us waiting in a nice foyer, while someone got us glasses of iced lemon water. But once we were ushered in, the experience began going downhill fast. First off, there are signs everywhere asking people to "be quiet in the spa areas" but the staff seems to be on auto-pilot and oblivious to the level of their voices, door slamming, etc. We were schlepped into changing rooms, handed ridiculously small bags to hold our belongings, and handed thin bathrobes and flip flops of "standard issue" one-size-fits-all, that in no way was going to fit my 6 ft 5 in partner, who was trying to figure out how to fit his sized 14 feet into flip flops for a size 9 woman. : ) Our attendant seemed slightly baffled when we asked for a larger size. Things went further downhill when we were turned over to a very nice young man in jeans and a hoodie - who seemed as out of place in this spa as an eskimo in a swim suit. He was very nice and polite, but not the right vibe for a "spa" attendent. Things got really ugly when we were taken outside (nothing but our flimsy thin robes on a cold and wet February day) to stand outside waiting for our "mud bath" room to open up. The room itself was scary, dark, dank, smelly, and reminded me of a basement. The mud baths were not what I expected at all -- they are mud mixed with some other substance (reminded me of peat moss), and they just seemed really, really gross. All I could think about when I was sitting in them was how many other people had sat in these same baths since the last time the mud had been changed! Our teenaged attendent returned to the room with such frequency to ask if we were "okay" etc., that we only got maybe 2 min. at a time to "relax" which was hard to do because he also kept turning out this incredibly obnoxious window fan that sounded like a small jet engine. Our total time in the "mud" bath couldn't have been more than 15 min. and that was after we gave up some of our "hot tub" time to stay in the baths longer. Midway through our "treatment" the teenager appeared with some sort of goo in a bowl and asked us if we wanted the face mud - which he then awkwardly rubbed on our faces, making the whole experience seem even odder. We then were expected to share one shower head, which was ridiculous. The shower was pretty scummy looking, and the entire time we were showing, the teenager was on the other side of our flimsy shower curtain hosing down the mud bath room with a hose. Totally bizarre. We were then taken to another room for our "heat wrap" which was the biggest joke of all (I was expecting heated blankets at least), but no such thing. They have you lay on some old massage tables and just wrap you up in some old motel blankets. In fact, the teenager wasn't even going to do this for us (he thought we'd be too hot), but I insisted since we were paying for it! Being wrapped up in the blankets in the dark room might have been relaxing had the teenager and other employees not been standing a few feet away from the room chatting while we were trying to "relax." We then went for a massage. I was holding out that maybe I would FINALLY get a chance to "relax" since we were away from the teenager, but no such luck. Within minutes of my massage beginning, and small toddler began shrieking in a nearby room. This went on for at least 5 minutes. The massage therapists seemed amused, but I wasn't, since I was there to RELAX and this was the least relaxing experience I've ever had relaxing anywhere! I had upgraded to the one hour massage, but the quality of the massage itself was below average. I was so frustrated by the time our "spa" experience was over that I was actually in tears. Because we stayed for 3 days, in the end our overall experience was decent. I give it a 4.5 for the mineral water quality, a 3.5 for the room, and a 2.5 for the spa experience. Would I go back? Yes, but only during the week when it is quieter, and I'd skip the groady mud baths entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: L2meH
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Golden Haven for many years. It is nothing fancy but is reasonably priced and offers mud baths, massages, and other spa related "treatments". They do not allow children on weekends and holidays so if you have little ones plan accordingly. The rooms are nice and the best part for our family is the indoor pool that is heated with geo- mineral water. Calistoga is a nice yet touristy town just a few blocks walk from Golden Haven. So you don't need to drive as long as it is not raining. There are several nice wineries in the area and to me it has somewhat of a mountain feel with the hills surrounding the area. AAA gets you a 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing, happy, and friendly stay we could have. :)”
Reviews.Author: navyangel92
Reviews.Content: Wow! Where to begin?! First off, it was the most incredible time. We went in early February. Weather was gorgeous. Staff was sooo friendly and helpful!! We did the Spa Getaway package with 1/2 hour massages and upgraded to a jacuzzi room. So worth the money. We spent time in the mineral pool and hot tub. Very relaxing. :) Kim was our spa attendant and she made us feel like royalty and so at ease. Def couldn't have asked for a better attendant. I hope to get her the next time we go. Nadine and Sally were our massage therapists. They kept the mood light and enjoyable. It was my first professional massage and I was so comfortable. My fiance enjoyed his massage as well. Thank you, Golden Haven Spa for such a wonderful experience. We feel so relaxed. :)

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven is the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: My first expierence at Golden Haven was for my honey moon and it was just perfect. We tried the mud bath and massage treatment. Once we had our first visit we knew we had to come back. Just recently we go back and it was for our anniversary!! It was like our honeymoon all over again and it was perfect! The staff... from resveration line; to the front desk; to the spa attendants is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are so comfortable and clean!!! My husband and I enjoyed ourselves so much that we plan to be back for all our anniversaries and any time we just need to get away! Actually I have already made resverations to bring my best friend for her birthday!!! I love Golden Haven and all it has to offer!!! If anyone is unsure on where to stay while visiting Calistoga...this is the place to be!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ATourist6
Reviews.Content: I just had a very pleasant two day spa "getaway" at the Golden Haven with a friend who was visiting from out of town. We stayed in a nice sized, one bedroom room where we both were able to relax in our own space and not pay a small fortune for the privilege. The room was super clean and nicely updated. We booked a complete "couples" spa package and each had mud bath, jacuzzi, blanket wrap, one hour massage and facials. We were pleased with the quality of the facilities and services. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. There is a pool and choice of either "warm" or "hot" jacuzzi to relax in after your swim. You are in close proximity to a number of nice restaurants, although you will need to walk or drive the 5 block distance.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: trigga415
Reviews.Content: Just stayed overnight on their "Stay for Free" promo that gives a choice of ANY room with purchase of the couples mudbath/ massage combo. The treatments were fun and effective, we felt so relaxed and sleepy afterwards :) Once we checked into our room after that, we found our own sauna room within and plenty of space with a nice skylight and our own patio. Staff was extremely friendly and never tried to squeeze extra dollars out of me for some odd reason that lots of inns do. My girlfriend and I had a great stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what it is”
Reviews.Author: monkey24
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times for spa treatments prior to this stay and would recommend them for their massages. They have great deals and wonderful massage therapists. They really know how to work the knots out of my back. However, I cannot give them as good of a review for overnight accomadtions. I stayed in a jacuzzi room for one night and can say that compared to other places I've stayed this was completely over priced for what you get. I could tell that they had recently updated the sink area of the bathroom, but the rest of the room could use a good update. The bed was old and uncomfortable to sleep in. The bedding looked like it was from the 80s. The jacuzzi uses the hot spring water, which can leave the room with an overwhelming smell. Make sure to open the windows to air it out. The tub itself is fairy old and is stained around the jets. Luckily they keep the room pretty clean. Overall, pros its near downtown Calistoga and the spa has great prices. Con's the room is extremely expensive ($200 a night) and you must get a spa treatment to stay there. The overall cost of the room does not equal what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Birthday Escape!!”
Reviews.Author: amariahhash
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday I decided to take her to Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa in Calistoga for one night. We booked a hotel room, couples mudbath, jacuzzi, and blanket wrap for 178+tax. It was amazing!! I also added a 1/2 hour massage for my wife. Brandon took care of us for our couples mud bath, jacuzzi, and blanket wrap. He was super professional, respectful, discreet, and a joy to be around. Thanks Brandon!! My wife had on;y a half hour massage, but said it was the best she had ever had. Thanks to Sue Unger I got back a relaxed and happy birthday girl. Thanks Sue!! Overall the staff was very pleasant, the room was very nice, and we had an amazing stay. Thanks Golden Haven, you are slice of heaven here on earth!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: em m
Reviews.Content: I would rate this place 4 stars, it got the job done, especially my massage which I really enjoyed. We opted for couples massage and mud bath which I had never done before and would have to say won't do again. The smell of the mud (volcanic) is just so gross it completely takes away from the experience. This place is not the nicest spa and not the worst. I think I would have preferred shelling out more money to get a massage at a very chic place.

Reviews.Title: “Get there Early!”
Reviews.Author: shaun2244
Reviews.Content: My wife has been coming to GHS for over 10 years and usually really enjoys her visit. On our last visit we were running a little behind so we called ahead to let them know. We ended up checking in literally 2 minutes late real time, 12 minutes late spa time (GHS has what they call spa time). Because their clocks are set 10 minutes ahead were late. OK... I can handle that, irritated but it is what it is. We reschedule for a hour later minus one of the planned treatments. GHS was 20 minutes late (GPS time) getting us into our massage and then cut our massage from 60 min. to 50 min. We talked to the receptionist and received no explanation. My wife emailed GHS and received no response. I'm not sure if GHS is under new management or if it was just an off day for the spa staff. So if you go to GHS make sure you are 10 min. early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Weekend Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: FLYINNOW
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven Hot Springs is a sweet little spa motel tucked away in Calistoga (Napa Valley), a town full of charm in itself. As per the other reviewers, it's not a 5-star resort hotel-- it's just simple accommodations at a reasonable price, given what you get as a package deal. We had a huge king suite with a deep jacuzzi tub (fed by the hot springs), fridge, TV, coffee maker and a couples spa treatment of our choice. I called the motel to make changes to our spa appointment a few times, and they were very gracious and flexible over the phone. We found the motel to be within a mile (walking distance) of town, which was no big deal. The only thing lacking was breakfast on the premises (continental would have been nice), so that was really the only inconvenience. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable and it was quiet when we stayed there. My husband had the mud bath and thoroughly enjoyed it, while I opted for the herbal jacuzzi bath and found it completely rejuvenating! Kimberly was our excellent attendant and she took very good care of us, wrapping us in warm towels and leaving us to snooze like babies after we got out of our tubs. Since we had flown to Napa from Sedona, Arizona (my husband is a pilot), this was a much-needed break after climbing around the Grand Canyon and Cathedral Rock. We were like jelly after the spa soaks! I highly recommend this place. "Fancy" doesn't matter, as long as you get good treatment, which we did. Also recommend the Petrified Forest (a 1 1/2 mile easy walk, but you have to drive a ways to get to it.) And you must visit the wineries of Napa Valley. We spent all day at Castello di Amorosa. It's a Tuscan-style castle which is nothing short of magnificent. Their wines are sold only in the castle and are well worth sampling. The grounds are beautiful-- lots of photo-ops. We would definitely come back and do this trip again, only stay longer to explore the region.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxxxxxxxed”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We arrived last minute. Sort of on a whim. The staff was helpful and pleasant and the room was very clean, though a bit datedt! But, we don't come to a place like this to stay in the room! It is all about the spa... which was excellent. A late appointment for a really warm, very theraputic mud bath and hot mineral bath. Then after a short cool down wrapped in a blanket, Nadine provided an absolutly outstanding deep tissue massage. It is nice to find a real massage therapist and not another 'oid and buff' specialist. A good night's sleep in their very quiet location and we took advantage of the mineral tubs and pool. We'll do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Charming, and really Clean!”
Reviews.Author: magpe
Reviews.Content: We stopped in calistoga without reservations and after many stops at fully booked hotels, we came across Golden Haven. We were worried because we noticed no cars in their parking lot on what seemed to be a fully booked weekend. After inquiring on cost and availability, my skeptical side said to ask to see the room. I thoroughly inspected every nook, cranny, and corner of that room and to my surprise it was exceptionally clean. We decided to stay and at check-in were given a list of everything we needed to know to make us comfortable. We found all the misc labels and info in the room so helpful. The bed and pillows were comfortable and we especially enjoyed the complimentary candies and bottles of water. We were in roon 4 which had 2 queens and one was in its own separate room. The room also had a wonderful oversize vanity area and had a small kitchen sink, a refrig, and a microwave and was stocked with the basics. Each unit has its own assigned parking spot - ours was right in front of our door. It was perfect so that we didnt have to worry about our car. Our favorite part of our stay was swimming in the mineral pool. It is very well kept. The water was clean and the pool area was spotless. It shows that this establishment takes the time to tend to the minor details. Its framework is a bit country cabin of the 70's but they've done a wonderful job sprucing it up so that it feels warm, fresh and inviting. We did not have time for the spa services but folks seemed to be enjoying them. Next time you visit calistoga, you may want to give Golden Haven a try. Its not the least expensive but its comparable to other hotels in the area. We fully expected it to be a dive but were very pleasantly surprised at how meticulously cared for this property is. We're definitely going back. Side note ~ the only suggestions we eould make to the hotel is to stck each room with a wine bottle opener and offer real creamer with your complimentary morning coffee. Otherwise all was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your $$$!!! Conveyor-belt treatments & service! :-( Questionable sanitation...”
Reviews.Author: SliceRSC
Reviews.Content: An absolute waste of $350 dollars! The facilities are really like a cheap motel converted into a Spa. There are some cute details on the outside, but as soon as we entered we were treated like sheep being herded by diselegant attendants. We were "moved along" to the couple's mud room - an ugly ill-appointed room by an attendant that was not very knowledgeable or understandable (albeit smiling). We received the WORST massages ever!(as a massage instructor i am pretty tolerant - but these were pitiful!) One of the therapists was a student still in school who fumbled through the session. The other had a repertoire of 3 or 4 moves which she repeated about 20 times in each spot with little to no pressure - we decided not to stay and could not get out of there fast enough! yuk! spare yourself! we later cruised around town checking out the other spas - Calistoga Inn & Spa looked MUCH nicer and is where we will be going next time.

Reviews.Title: “Here's Mud in Your Eye!!”
Reviews.Author: donscameron45
Reviews.Content: Great couples experience. Fun to get muddy, relax and talk. Massages afterward are super relaxing. Quiet and away from the main street traffic, but not too far away. Great restaurants only three blocks away. Tis was our first visit, but it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: wendylee_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to napa valley and stumbled upon Golden Haven Hot Springs and Resort, Calistoga. We loved everything about it from the warm and friendly reception, spacious, clean room with kitchen amenitites, pretty & quiet setting just off the main street. Bonus: inexpensive for all that you get compared to other accommodations. a great "down to earth" place to begin each day and also to chill out in the evening. We treated ourselves to a mud bath/mineral pool session for couples. It was interesting and very relaxing! The staff is wonderful! Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Spa treatment was fantastic and the room was so modern”
Reviews.Author: qt22x
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent spa in the Napa Valley area and great if you can get one of their couple mid-week deais. We both had a mud treatment and felt rejuvenated afterward. The room was so nice and modern and the bed was really comfortable. I cannot fault the rooms at all! Just perfect. The only thing that let the hotel down was that there are no on site catering facilities so you have to drive or walk 10mins into the downtown area to get a breakfast. Would be nice if they could just provide a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We plan on coming back soon .”
Reviews.Author: Rosa S
Reviews.Content: We were very thankful to have found a room without reservation, and to get great service. We loved the location of your hotel. It's the perfect place for a get away. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, central but expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Jule2201
Reviews.Content: Went to Calistoga for two days to show my parents from Germany the California wine country. The rooms where huge but we expected more friendly, newer furnishings. The Spa it outside, not in the house you stay at! Nice outdoor decorations. Friendly stuff. City center in walking distance (15minutes). The pool is oldfaschioned, under a roof and does not look like wellness. Sun terrace is small and definitely free of luxury. All in all, we would choose an other hotel next time. But we do not regret our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "girlfriends weekend!"”
Reviews.Author: Gayleo
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at Golden Haven for one night with a spa treatment. It was perfect for us! The room was nice - we each got our own King bed, and it had a fridge too. The room was updated and new. The spa treatment was nice, our first mud bath. I thought the massage could have been a bit longer. The pool was a little outdated. But the location was great. Overall, we had a great time and will come back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased and will return”
Reviews.Author: CaptPhil24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a place to stay following an evening BBQ at Prager Port Works where we are members. We came across the Golden Harvest Inn & Spa and decided to book a room for 1 evening followed by a mud bath the next day. We were extremely impressed with the warm welcome from everyone at the front desk and the cleanliness of the room. We started our afternoon in the wonderful hot spring jacuzzi followed by a nice swim in the covered pool. Our room had a hot tub for trwo in it so my wife and I enjoyed a relaxing soak when we returned from our BBQ. Sunday was our day to detox in our private mud bath room. Kim was our attendant and she was awesome. All in all we would say we had an extremely pleasant stay and great experience. We will be looking forward to more short getaway visits. Don't hesitate to book a stay with these folks, they are great.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time and would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: Oaktownboi4
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner (who has just moved here from Brazil and never been to Napa Valley), decided it was time to go to the wine country, do a little wine tasting and then go have a mud bath and massage at a spa in Calistoga. We just happened to pick up this years copy of PINK SPOTS and noticed the nice add for Golden Haven. So we took a chance and booked our treatments and decided to go for it and get the room with a spa in the room. The people were very nice, the room was very clean and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girlfriends Getaway”
Reviews.Author: seeyathere
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for weekend getaway. Clean, spacious rooms, one story with front porches, nice mineral water swimming pool, 2 hot tubs, (hot and hotter), wonderful hour massage. Ask for massage therapist Angela Marzi. Located in a quiet residential neighborhood. No view from rooms, but mountain view if you stroll around the neighborhood. Very convenient to wine tasting. Skipped the mud bath so can't report on that.

Reviews.Title: “SPA only -- Overall excellent experience, but other guests were very rude and the rooms are noisy.”
Reviews.Author: cave7492
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went to Golden Haven two weeks ago for a couples mud bath and one hour massage. Our attendant took us to our private couples mud room. She was very courteous and professional in giving us instructions on what to do. She left us to wiggle down into the mud bath then came back when we were covered to pile mud around our shoulders, put on a quick mud face mask and then gave us a cold washcloth for our forehead. Next we rinsed off in the shower fed by mineral water (the attendant turned on the water and adjusted the temperature for us while we were in the mud bath). Finally we relaxed in the Jacuzzi tub fed by the hot springs. The mud and minerals left our skin feeling soft and silky!! 3 When we were in the relaxation room, another guest stormed into the room speaking very loudly and said â€œOh, oops, I was looking for the bathroom!â€� even though the doors are very well labeled. Then we could still hear her and her friends talking when she left our room. The Spa needs to make an effort to control discourteous guests and remind ALL guests to keep their voices low at all times. Next we went in for our couples massage. A fantastic massage! We felt like the masseuses really listened to our concerns. Unfortunately, we could hear the cleaning staff rolling their carts along the sidewalk outside the window. After the massage we were taken to our own small private bathroom with a shower with two showerheads, toilet and sink. If you want five-star luxury (and five-star prices) go to the Spa Solage but if you are looking for a relaxing experience for a good value Golden Haven is a nice choice. But remember to bring your own flip-flops, these arenâ€™t provided.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: yauany
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, we have a two-bedroom suite, and there's a sauna room inside, so amazing. we also booked the mud spa there, I rememered 2 years ago my first time to try the mud bath thing, i told myself i would never do it again, but apparently i forgot how nasty the feeling, i was here again last weekend with my girlfriends. It was still fun but still very nasty. I dont know if they change the mud or not. Recommened to do the mud bath at night, after a whole day of napa sightseeing and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted and refunded”
Reviews.Author: ggomes04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation in Napa and wanted a relaxing spa day. We booked 1 hour facials and massages and Golden Haven b/c we saw an ad in our hotel room. When we showed up were taken back by how run down the place was, we decided to give it a try. We had been told when we made the reservation that we should bring our bathing suits to use the jacuzzi and mineral water pool, so we did. After checking in (v. unfriendly customer service) we went for a swim in the pool. The pool area is gated and covered and looks like something out of a concentration camp. The bathrobe I was given was had rips on the sleeve, the jacuzzi was so gross and brown inside, the pool shower had hair all over the stall. We walked back into the main office and asked for a full refund. We were so disgusted !! The room where the facial was to happen looked fine, but after seeing everything else I didn't want to stay there another second.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: spicewoody
Reviews.Content: We just happened upon Golden Haven and couldn't have been more pleased. Great value for the money. Extremely clean, friendly and helpful staff. We didn't have the opportunity to use the pool area, but it seemed like others were enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Hhlive2ski
Reviews.Content: For the price this place is great. Nice service, pools were great. But dont expect a 5star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best mud bath in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: mnmitkoff2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I cannot recommend Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa enough. It is located off the main highway, is prefessionally maintained, and is by far a great experience. Be sure to upgrade to the Jacuzzi room and look for their Last Minute Specials on their website www.goldenhaven.com. Our mud bath (couples package) lasted about an hour which included the actual mud bath for about 15-20 minutes. Then followed by a warm private shower and a wonderful, natural mineral jacuzzi hot tub experience. We were pampered beyond reproach and always made to feel comfortable, taken care of and attended to. After the mud bath we were taken to the 'cool down' room with iced towels for our necks and foreheads with soft lighting and soothing music. We bought the message package which followed that which was wonderful! We researched our options in Calistoga thoroughly and are grateful we decided on Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa! Book your trip now! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Small Town Charm”
Reviews.Author: djhershey
Reviews.Content: We found this place online the night before we headed their direction on our road trip. Thought it would be fun to get the "mud bath" as neither of us have ever tried it. We were able to check in early. Our room was dated but clean and larger than I expected, complete with a small kitchenette. All the water on the property is from hot springs, shower, pool, hot tubs. Used the pool and the jacuzzis, had a sunning area up above the pool. The town is closeby and we explored and had dinner before our mud bath. I can't say we loved the mud bath experience, but it was an experience and we can now check it off our list. Our spa attendant was very professional, unlike what some other reviewers have described. If you are sensitive to heat in the slightest, opt for a massage instead of mud bath.

Reviews.Title: “Muddy pampering and warm relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Italian_kilt
Reviews.Content: This was our last night of our road trip, before heading into San Francisco. Check in went smoothly. The hotel was laid out in a motel style. We were in room 19 above the reception area, which was quiet, no problem with noise. The room was large, nice clean bathroom (good shower). Free internet access which was handy. Plenty of parking within the hotel. No breakfast provided, which we were aware of. The town centre was a short walk away to all the shops and restaurants. We also had the mud bath, jacuzzi, blanket wrap that was included in our room package. We also added a 30min massage. This was amazing, from start to finish we both really enjoyed it and we felt so good and relaxed after it. All staff were very friendly and professional. A great end to our road trip, feeling refreshed. Would stay here again and do the spa treatments again.

Reviews.Title: “We Thought This Was a Joke... Where is the camera??!”
Reviews.Author: mlebaskin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to book a 'Couples Mud Bath' at Golden Haven. We found a coupon in our bed and breakfast nearby, and Golden Haven was very highly reviewed and seemed to be a legend in Callistoga. We are not by any means snooty spa-connoisseurs.... but this was the most ridiculous place we've ever been. Highlights, (or should I say lowlights...) *We were escorted into a room that looked like an old YMCA pool changing room that had a HUGE hole in the ceiling and asked to undress and slip into the mud bath. Instead of being given a locker/robe, there was one plastic lawn chair in the room for us to put all our winter clothes on, boots, bra, underwear, coats, etc. A nice guy who looked to be maybe a high school kid in jeans and a TShirt knocked to come in before our naked selves were even down into the mud.... so we hurried things up and plunged down and covered up our dangling bits. The kid in jeans then brings me a face mask that he asks to paint on to my face. I was trying not to laugh because he looked so uncomfortable! He then goes over to my husband and shows him the paintbrush of face mask and says, "Dude, you want some too?" We were then supposed to get out and shower after 10 minutes or so and then soak in a hot tub. The kid in jeans told us that the shower was a little tricky--- which we soon found out meant BOILING or FREEZING. We were trying to scrape the mud off ourselves and shower off in literally ice water (while naked under florescent light) when the kid in jeans comes back in and decides to hose down the room while we're showering together in the ice. (The shower has a curtain about as thin as notebook paper and about knee-level... no bending over is recommended!) Meanwhile, our clothes are still hanging off the lawn chair. After the kid in jeans leaves, we run over to the 'hot tub' which is water that has not been changed from every other couple that day. We were sitting in naked-couple-mud-water. Seriously. In extremely open view of the door, which the kid in jeans is hovering behind. Finally, still partially covered in mud and grossed out from the 'hot tub,' the kid in jeans puts a towel in the corner, so we hop out and wrap up in a towel, pick up all our winter clothes and personal belongings in our arms, and then make our way to another room where the kid in jeans says we're going to be given a heat wrap. He pulls the sheets apart of two cots and tells us to jump in. (We're wet, naked, and covered in a bed sheet when he comes back in.) He then puts a hotel blanket.... might have been velour in 1978, but now it's a matted old hotel blanket... and wraps it around us, puts a cold cloth on our eyes, cranks up some music, and tells us to relax. The music was hysterically bad-- so bad that we were CONVINCED we were on candid camera. Finally, after our 'wrap'... (a BLANKET wrap...!)... we were shown into the 'dressing room.' It was a SHOWER. like a YMCA shower!!!! Still wet, still covered in mud, and laughing so hard we were crying, we made our way back to our bed and breakfast. We have honestly NEVER laughed so hard together in our marriage... I guess that's a plus. If I were you, I'd choose a different way to spend an evening in Callistoga-- there are certainly lovely choices in such a beautiful little town!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mud Bath”
Reviews.Author: bdkc1959
Reviews.Content: Went there with my husband and we enjoyed the mud bath. We had Sara and she was great with us. We had a lot of privacy and it was very relaxing. Don't let the reviews scare you away it was worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: RBTorres675
Reviews.Content: I booked a massage and spa package at this place for my birthday thinking it was gonna be this beautiful elegant place because of the location of the city its in (Calistoga). I was so wrong! when me and my husband pulled into this hotel it looked like people lived there, it was trashy, run down, and dirty. Since we drove there from outta town, I decided to just stay and give it a try plus I had already made payment over the phone to reserve our spot which i was told is unrefundable. The massage was really bad, the room we had massages in was bright with a uncovered window along with a very loud fan blowing the whole time with no relaxing music. After we were finished we had these cheap looking robes they hung on the wall for us that looked like reused picnic cloths to wear while we walked over to the shower. The shower was absolutely GROSS!! no shower shoes were offered to us so we had to throw a towel inside the shower floor to protect our skin from any fungus or anything else that might have been left behind from the previous shower users. I had asked for my money back after our terrible experience and the manager in charge was very unprofessional he did not want to come out and speak directly to me, he sent his employee out to relay what he had to say about my complaint, So then i contacted the owner of the company and the he acted a FOOL with me over the phone, he didnt care about what i had to say and was loudly speaking over me. I was so upset with this place, I would NOT recommend this place to anybody! its a total waste of time and money. Your better off going to your local motel 6 and just pay some crackhead off the street to give you a massage. Rebecca T.

Reviews.Title: “Experience I wish I would have missed”
Reviews.Author: caralea09
Reviews.Content: The experience I had at Golden Haven Spa could have ruined an otherwise great Sister Weekend if we didn't have as good a sense of humor as we had. This place made Motel 6 look like a 5 star facility. There is no changing room and if you aren't a hotel guest you have to carry all your stuff around with you. There is no locker room, so you must change in bathrooms. The robes (and I use the term loosly) were sheet thin and were embarrassing to wear, while naked underneath, through the lobby out the front door, through the construction workers and up the stairs to the massage rooms. There were dirty sheets sitting in the lobby, the staff was busy talking to eachother right in front of guest, it was a disgusting experience. I felt bad, but we didn't leave but a small tip, because the experience was so bad. If you are looking for a unique experience for your trip, skip GOLDEN HAVEN, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE FOR SPA TREATMENTS!”
Reviews.Author: kaestu
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that anyone reviewing this establishment could give this place a positive review!!! I don't know what made my sister and I continue through the entire treatment, but it was probably because they made us pay BEFORE the spa treatments, which should have been a clue that we should leave with our money. We did not stay at the hotel, but rather came for the supposed luxurious spa treatments. But considering the hotel looked like it might rent "by the hour", we wouldn't have stayed there anyway. What spa doesn't have a dedicated changing room with an area to keep your belongings? All we got was a green mesh bag to hold our things and we had to carry everything from room to room. There was also renovation going on with about 10 construction workers working right out in front of the spa, which is fine, except that we hadn't been warned. We also weren't warned that we would have to WALK OUTSIDE in nothing but our PAPER THIN ROBES and walk THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION WORKERS, up a flight of stairs in order to reach the massage room. This was apparently only because of the renovation, but again, we were not told this was going to be necessary until they came to get us for the massage portion. We were lucky that WE had the foresight to bring sandals with us, otherwise we would have had to do this in bare feet or put our boots back on! Then, when we got upstairs, they sat my sister down next to a pile of dirty sheets!!! To further detail our "pampering" experience, the blanket wrap was NOT a blanket wrap by anyone's description (except, apparently, Golden Haven's description.) It was simply a table with a hospital sheet and a blanket, neither of which were wrapped around us. The mud bath was an interesting experience, and was fine. I mean, how glamorous can mud be? But for the shower portion, all that separated my sister and I from our male attendant was a flimsy, too small shower liner! And the jacuzzi was old and stained. But at least we had cool air blowing on us from the HOLES in the WALL (!) while we were in the hot jacuzzi.This place CLEARLY has NO idea how to pamper anyone, let alone organize a spa treatment or CLEAN! I could go on and on about the hideous experience we had, but I think you get the idea. I just don't know what kept us there for the entire treatment....oh yeah, I forgot....the aforementioned pre-payment! I am appalled that AAA approves this establishment and they should really reconsider!

Reviews.Title: “DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: slimmy2011
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went here 2 weeks ago for my birthday. We have been to many differnt massages from a variety of places in the local region so we know what to expect. This place was hands down the worst massage experience I have ever had. You might as well get a room at your local $20 a night hotel and ask the clerk at the counter to give you a massage. This place was filthy and not at all what it looked like in the pictures. The showers were grimy, the robes were cheap and thin, the mesus's belly fat rubbed against me the whole time, his nails were long and scratched me during the massage. Needless to say we did not leave a tip. There was NOTHING relaxing about this place. I can't believe other people gave this place decent reviews. They must be staff members posing as customers to post false reviews. If you can tell, YES I am upset. After the worst massage ever the owner was rude, refused to refund me and did not offer an apology. If you want a good massage DONT GO HERE.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maimone
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place! Quiet! Relaxing! From the moment we checked in we felt so welcome. The spa treatments were fabulous! Our room was absolutely charming and spotless. You can tell they really want you to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Our most relaxing vacation yet”
Reviews.Author: kmanrique
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived early but since our room wasn't quite ready they moved up our appointment for our mud bath which was amazing. I had never had one before so was unsure of what to expect we were so relaxed it just melts all the stress away and you feel so good and your skin feels so soft afterwards. The staff is very professional and kind, so I felt very comfortable. The room was clean and spa like the bed was very comfortable. We loved that the pool was indoors and so warm. we rarely get to go swimming so it was a treat to just be able to walk into a warm pool no easing into cold water here it was so relaxing and fun. Then we had a dip in the hot spa then off to the room to get ready for dinner. You can walk or drive to the main street we chose to walk (about 6 blocks) charming town with cute shops and amazing retaurants. We can't wait to come again!! You can tell the owners take pride in their place as the flower pots were full and landscaping was being done to get ready for spring.

Reviews.Title: “discreet,relaxing,clean”
Reviews.Author: addquilter
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at hotel,we did a couples mud bath and 1/2 hour massage. At the very start we were given a net bag to hold our belongings and clothes.Our attendant introduced himself, took us in the room for the mud bath, explained how to get in the mud baths and stepped out so we could undress and get in the bath The attendant always knocked before entering. Each step in the procedure was explained in advance.We were given robes to wear.Extremely relaxing. Would do this agin. Next time we would use the Mineral pool before our mud bath/massage treatment. We were too relaxed after the treatment to want to swim. Our belongings were never out of sight.

Reviews.Title: “A great mud trip ...”
Reviews.Author: bmace2
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise. Last minute booking, Golden Haven was much nicer than we expected. 2nd floor room was OK - nice bathroom, comfortable bed; ground floor suites much nicer. Spa staff was outstanding. Loved the couples mud room, hot tub and wrap room. Sharing the experience made it so much better overall. Walk to town for a fantastic dinner at Jole. Hike to Holm's Place was right down the street (5 hour hike, beautiful views.) Book well ahead - Calistoga fills up on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: hmvme
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Golden Haven Spa & Resort ($150 per night) and would not recommend this run down place to anyone. They call it a spa and resort, but is actually very old with no telephones in the rooms. The T.V. was a 15 year old Zenith that didn't work, and had problems with the WI-FI. The main reason we went was to soak in the hot springs pool. First of all the pool is in very poor condition. To hide the pool deck condition, they have put down heavy plastic mats all around the pool that hurt your bare feet. The actual pool is located inside a steel farm building with exposed columns. It was cold inside the area and they had put up clear plastic tarps on the open wall to try and keep some heat in. Everything in the rooms was very old including the rusty portable electric heater. The staff was not very friendly and was actually rude when asked about a AAA discount. The very next day we stayed at the new Ivy Best Western in Napa for about $80. This place was new from top to bottom. The staff was very nice and they have a wonderful breakfast included. We will go back to the Ivy next year for sure. R. S.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed & rejuvenated”
Reviews.Author: NanaPops
Reviews.Content: We keep going back year after year because we like it! From the coed mud baths & treatments to the convenient location (we can walk to everything in Calistoga without being downtown) to the comfortable lodging, Golden haven is our favorite, simple, annual retreat from the treadmill that is our life! And, of course, you are a short drive to all of the wonderful Alexander Valley/Napa Valley winerys & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The "Ultimate Getaway", a spa package highly recommended and appropriately named!”
Reviews.Author: tomharman
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, every Golden Haven Spa experience leaves my wife and I thoroughly relaxed, rejuvenated and ready to be released back into the wild. I say this because we both have stressful jobs and live very active lifestyles that would be impossible to continue without scheduling-in some spa-time in between. I recommend The Golden Haven Spa experience to anyone who lives life like us or to anyone else who is just looking to unwind and reconnect with mind, body, and spirit. Because it's such a jungle out there we frequently put our own health & wellness on the low priority list by taking care of others most of our working lives. A visit to Golden Haven at least 4-6 times per year allows us to continue taking care of others at this pace without going insane. So when you think about it for a second, taking care of others can only be acheived by taking care of yourself periodically. That's where Golden Haven Spa comes into play. You check-in, you're under their care from start to finish. No matter if you live local or far away, Golden Haven is the best place to go to de-stress and recharge your batteries. My wife and I live an hour away and don't have much time for long vacations, so we go to Golden Haven for our "stay-cation. The Ultimate Getaway is highly recommended and appropriately named because the staff and facilities make you feel like it's truly all about YOU. If I had the responsibility of creating a slogan for Golden Haven, it would read; WELCOME TO GOLDEN HAVEN, because now it IS all about YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Blissful Pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: fhrtopa
Reviews.Content: Mud-I love Mud-2 days of relaxation for my Wife and I. We planned on 1 night and ended up extending it for 2 nights in our Jacuzzi room wich was awesome. Use of the Mineral pool and Hot Tubs was amazingly pleasurable and the price for the whole two days was another amazing Gift for the both of us. And would recommend this place to anybody interested in having a pampered day of relaxation.Total stress reliever! Jim G....from Marin county....get Muddy people.... P.S. We also had a good time checking out the local History of Calistoga and just walking around the Town.

Reviews.Title: “This place is total relaxtion!”
Reviews.Author: cadenning2
Reviews.Content: Have heard all about Calistoga and the mud baths. Finally retirement started and so did our search for relaxation, destressing and just getting away. I read about Golden Haven and sorted thru the negatives and positives so went with a open mind. We went on a Monday but looked as tho a lot of people were around. Our appointments were kept on time and both mud bath and massage was perfect! Nice and private at all times, the gals were always respective asking if she can come in. The mud was hot and stinky but sooo soothing. Lime Iced water was all over to remind us to keep hydrated. The massages were great especially my 2nd day, Anett was superb concentrating on my areas I mentioned as my stress holding areas. We loved the pool area and were there for hours as all 3 pools were needed! A swimming pool set at 86, a hot tub with normal water set at 102 and a natural spring water hot tub at 108, SWEET!! We talked to a lot of interesting Americans and Canadians and enjoyed that relaxing time...The Golden Haven is great at what they do. I don't mind some young girls being happy at the desk or anywhere for that matter and laughing is great to hear so I can overlook others commenting on the loud desk area. It is the front desk! Our room was quiet and nicely decorated. We had our own parking space right in front of the room. We had a room with the jacuzzi and aside from the mineral water changing colors of the tub it was spotless. We almost cried at the thought of leaving this place. Enjoyed the neighborhood it was in, gave us a chance to walk in a neighborhood like at home and everyone was so friendly as we walked....must be all that mineral water they soak in!!! I liked that little envelopes were left out with the attendants names on it for tips that could be dropped off at the front desk at our convenience. I asked for a extra blanket for the room and got a comfy warm one delivered. Morning coffee was served at the office which kept hubby happy as I slept in a bit more. Town was good for breakfast, lunch or dinner for us for 3 days. By Tuesday the place was pretty empty and Wednesday we could have had a massage or mud at pretty much any time. This was the perfect time of year to visit without the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Couples Mud Bath Experience”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: We decided to have our first ever mud bath here since they had couples baths. I had already talked my husband into doing it and he said he would only do it if we could be together. It definitely was an experience and the staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the whole process. We were taken to our room with 2 mud tubs, a large shower off area with curtains and 2 sprays and a little hot tub. Our girl told us how to get in the mud and left us alone to get in in private. After we were ready, she knocked on the door and came in to put the mask on our face and mud on our shoulders. She left and came back a few minutes later to put cold cloths on our heads. Then, she told us to scrape off and go into the showers to clean off after about 15 minutes. The mud was very hot by then anyway. While we were showering, she cleaned up the mud in the room. Then, she left so we could get into the hot tub for a few mintues. We didn't last very long in there, because we were really hot. We toweled off and put on our robes and waited for her to come get us. She then took us to our "nap room" where she let us get under a sheet then she came in to tuck us in with blankets and put cold compresses on our head and neck. We were left there for about 20 minutes to relax and nap. Neither of us feel asleep. After our rest, we went to the mineral pool and hot tubs for a little bit and showered and changed in the pool area. It was a fun experience and while I don't think I'd be dying for a mud bath again, I'd go again if someone else wanted to and would recommend this place. The mud feels really weird, gets warm at the bottom and has a little weird smell to it, but if you close your eyes and just let yourself relax, it's a relaxing experience being suspended in the warm mud.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: mtall62
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be our last stop on our trip, suppose to be the best had sign up for the couples mud bath deal. Well the room was like it was stuck in the 70's or something the king bed was on top of two twin bed frames. It was only two of us and yet they put us in a room that had two rooms and was charged for the second room saying that it was part of the spa and room special and when i complained and recalculated this "deal" it was more expensive then a regular room and the mud bath. But they did give me a refund of 8 bucks of the difference still didn't change my room. The mud bath is nothing like whats on their website we were in a room that looked like it was some shed in some third world not relaxing or comfortable at all. Mud tube was not next to each other rather it was like corner tubes so our feets were closer. After the bath I had to hose myself off with a HOSE! and then got in the jacuzzi for like 10mins before we were rushed to our blanket wrap room which looked more like a sleezy massage parlor room. Blanket wrap from the picture they show and what we got like night and day it was one thin blanket that was wraped not at all like the pictures. Couldnt relax there either because you can hear the staff talking out side the door. And their Wifi didn't work with the Ipad or iphone. This place sucks rip me off, i would rather stay at the best western cheaper and cleaner more modern.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, couples' experience”
Reviews.Author: Missus_Kay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this spa to take in our first mudbath because it is one of the view places in Calistoga that allows couples to enjoy the experience together in privacy. We had no trouble booking our appointment because we came in on a Monday, avoiding the weekend crowd, which is what we recommend if you want to enjoy Napa Valley at a more chilled out pace. The reception staff was pleasant and professional. The facility itself, was clean and presented in warm mauve tones. While it is not the poshest place in town, it caters to those who do not want to spend a fortune on spa services. Our mudbath experience was unlike anything we have ever done before, because the mud vat (for lack of a better term), is quite deep and the sensation is like that of being submersed in porridge or oatmeal. The mud was very hot deeper down, but the attentive spa assistant helped to make sure that we were comfortable and also put a clay mask and cooling cloth on our faces. The feeling of being suspended in hot mud removed all of the tightness in my muscles! My husband could only take about 10 minutes of the treatment, but I stayed until I was instructed that it was time to hose down. After hosing down with a mineral water shower, we sat in a mineral water jacuzzi and drank the cold cucumber water solution, which we found refreshing. After this, we put on our robes and were escorted to the cool down room where we lay down and were covered with blankets, darkness and soothing music. My husband nodded off which I understand is a common occurence. We both enjoyed the experience very much and found it therapeutic. We followed this up with a nice lunch, and winery tour. I would do this again. My husband is happy having done it once. He's done the Calistoga mudbath thing, and he can tick it off his list but I will definitely do this again at Golden Haven Hot Spring the next we are up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MarkA0218
Reviews.Content: We went to Calistoga for a relaxing weekend. We booked Golden Haven, they have excellent packages with a jacuzzi or sauna room and mudbath and massage. Can't wait till the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MarilynHH
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed our last night in the Napa Valley in the resort. We had mud baths and massage appointments after a fun day wine tasting. The experience could have been better. We enjoyed our quiet room and the entire staff was excellent. We also booked online and received an excellent price for staying on Tuesday.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this out of your California tour”
Reviews.Author: 577PAK
Reviews.Content: What a place ,the staff were great, the mud baths made you feel good. The hotel is well situated for the town, far enough out ,but close enough to walk in to town ,the town has all the facillites one reuires

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven is a wonderful retreat from life's stress”
Reviews.Author: havenmeister1
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Golden Haven Hot Springs and had a wonderful time. the room was charming and spacious. My husband and I shared a mudbath - they do couples mudbaths - and it was relaxing and fun. How often do grownups get to play in the mud? The hottub and pool were fun, too. It's a nice walk to the center of the town of Calistoga. All in all, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “MINERAL SPA, MUD BATHS & OTHER GREAT PAMPERING”
Reviews.Author: westcoastComedyshows
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to the GH (Golden Haven Hot Springs Spa) we knew that we had chosen the most relaxing weekend spot in Calistoga. Victory for us! The front desk staff welcomed us with smiles and a great sense of humor. Sometimes places in wine country areas, like Napa or Calistoga, tend to be slightly over run by snotty wine sniffers and posh-posh "me first" people that can really ruin a getaway weekend. While I'm sure GH may HAVE to attend to those kinds of clients time to time, my partner and I were never forced to cross paths with them or any other people really for that matter (other than on the main street and wine tasting rooms, obviously). It certainly helped that GH had plenty of dinner delivery menus, restaurant recommendation lists and winery listings IN THE ROOM! Mud bathing was a new experience for us - but our attendant Alma was an awesome help and walked us through each stage with ease. The music was soothing. The isolation/cool down room was relaxing and I'm sorry I snored...but It was THAT RELAXING! As an anniversary weekend retreat- I think I found another keeper. I know I will be back next year... Thanks everyone. Keep that awsome pool warm.. we will see you next October for the HARVEST! My Sincerest Gratitude -Jay Smith (B.i.a.t.c.h.)

Reviews.Title: “We won't go back”
Reviews.Author: lawmom555
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven is not a spa. It is a regular roadside motel. It is clean and has a pool and hot tub. It is vastly overpriced, but everything in Napa Valley seems overpriced. We stayed there for only one reason: to have the "couples" mud bath. The mud bath was an experience. Not pleasant, but something we can say we did and won't do again. The mud bath room is dark and dreary and has a dungeon-like feel. Towels are threadbare and rough. The mats on the floor between the mud baths/shower/mineral water soak are very rough and painful to walk on. An experience we can now say we did, but not worth the nearly $300 package price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Haven was Nice!”
Reviews.Author: lamorris99
Reviews.Content: I gave Golden Haven 4 stars....but don't come here actually expecting a 4 star hotel. I rated it 4 stars in comparison to other properties offering the same services in Calistoga. Golden Haven was affordable for us, and we still felt pampered. Our treatments were very good...we did the couples mud bath and 1/2 hour massages. It was very relaxing and the 1/2 hr went by way too quickly. My husband was very impressed with the mud. I was having way too much fun trying to throw it at him! The rooms at Golden Haven were simple from the outside, but we were impressed with the vaulted ceilings on the inside. (I don't think all of the rooms have this type of ceiling though). Everything about the hotel was simple, and more like a 3 star property. But it was sufficient for us, and (most importantly) affordable. The hotel only has like 16 rooms, so it seemed as if we were alone. When we got in the pool at night there were only 2 other people in there. They have 2 hot tubs, so there was a lot of space. The pizza place, La Prima, was good too...if you are looking for an affordable dinner (they also deliver). In summary, if you are having a hard time affording Calistoga...then this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: winechick25
Reviews.Content: Golden Haven was amazing. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The rooms were clean and welcoming. U have a space with a fridge and sink microwave. They have a small patioish area out front of the room which is nice to hang out in the morning and enjoy your coffee. Plus the beds are comfy!! I would totally recommend this place to others and I can't wait to go back. Now when we stay in Napa Valley we will stay at Golden Haven!!

Reviews.Title: “Indulge in Mud!”
Reviews.Author: 2CtheWorld4Two
Reviews.Content: Our three days in Napa Valley started off with a real adventure: A â€œCouples Mud Bathâ€� at Golden Haven Hot Springs. Though my husband wasnâ€™t too keen on the idea, he literally jumped in feet first, ready to share another adventure with me as we explored the world. A bit hard to find since it is in a residential area, we were happy once we did. The mud bath starts off by stripping down, putting on a robe provided, and entering into the mud room. Two large concrete baths are connected which are heated through the walls to warm the mud. More granular (almost like very wet peat moss) than expected, our attendant showed us how to slip in- bottom first- then slowly sink into the mud and lay back. Sheâ€™d set up wooden planks to lay our heads back on and brought cold washcloths for our foreheads. Suspended now, we lay back to live in the moment... to wallow in the mud... to be surrounded by something forbidden in childhood (â€œDonâ€™t get dirty!) but enjoyed here. We rinsed off the mud then plunged into a hot bubbling tub of the world famous Calistoga Mineral Water to soak and soothe. Opting to get a full body massage, I went to meet my massage therapist while my sweetheart took advantage of the resort facilities: Indoor pool and two large hot tubs, one filled with the mineral water. I joined him after my massage and we left feelingr relaxed, refreshed, and renewed. The facilities were adequate, not luxurious, and somewhat worn. My hope is that they will remodel soon as the whole experience would then achieve an â€œExcellentâ€� rating. TIP: Look for their great discount coupons in the local publications!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, I need that!”
Reviews.Author: smartbl0nde
Reviews.Content: I live on the beautiful Central California Coast but I hadn't seen the sun for two months. I had also been through some stressful times and hadn't taken any time off. I knew I needed to go back to the Golden Haven Resort in Calistoga. This time with my husband who will always takes care of me instead of girlfriends who depend on me. When I left Golden Haven Resort, I had spent so much time in the sun and the rest of my time relaxing in the variety of ways offered at this resort, that my body and spirit have truely been renewed. Thank you Golden Haven. I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sheabutter4
Reviews.Content: I came in to the facility and it was so calm and peaceful and the rooms I slept like a baby I have sleeping problems and there I received the best sleep ever Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Although there wasn't anything we could...”
Reviews.Author: 6weekholidays
Reviews.Content: Although there wasn't anything we could complain about, in fact our stay was lovely, it just debt have the wow factor that we were expecting from a Spa in the Napa Valley. Maybe our expectations were too high, but the quality of the swimming pool and spa was not the best. However, the rooms were fantastic and the mud bath was pretty cool! Make sure you get a good deal to make the most of this resort, don't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing mud bath experience tied with excellent, helpful staff and great room made this a number one experience for us.”
Reviews.Author: Lourex
Reviews.Content: The mud bath five step experience was well thought out. Sinking in the mud made my husband and I giggle at the sensation of the mud all around. The staff was very professional each step of the way.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing and pampered mini vacation I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: quiltstersue
Reviews.Content: My two adult daughters and I arrived a little early for the start of our day of pampering. The whole spa experience was one my daughters and I can hardly wait to do again. I never dreamed I'd ever take a mud bath, but it was wonderful! The mineral water jacuzzi and the cool down wrap - relaxing, relaxing, relaxing! And then we were off to the massages and facials. What a wonderful way to complete the experience! My whole body and spirit felt healthier and energized. We also had at our disposal a large mineral water swimming pool and two jacuzzis to use as we like during our stay. The facilities were clean, comfortable, and private. The grounds are small but filled with floral color and water fountains. We had a very comfortable room complete with two bedrooms, airconditioning, ceiling fan, cable tv, microwave, refrigerator, and comfy beds. Outside each room are mosaic tables and chairs to sit upon and enjoy the cool evenings and beautiful mornings. Part of Golden Haven's charm is that it is not a large, impersonal facility. What we liked most about our stay was the staff. They are what made this experience one that we would like to do over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMoreno
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!!! Its looks like you are in a JAIL not a spa!! Nothing smells good and nothing looks nice. WHAT A MESS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gross -- very gross!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scottyp920
Reviews.Content: Just imagine how many people before you were in the same mud bath. I could not get that out of my head the entire 12 minutes. "The mud removes toxins from you body." Okay -- where do these toxins go in the mud? Does that mean everyone is soaking in a toxic bath? YUCK!!!!! People it's not worth the money. Skip it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a really great experience”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyagelc
Reviews.Content: I went to Golden Haven with my mom and sister for a birthday weekend. Our room was very clean, the staff was courteous and helpful, the mineral pools and grounds were lovely and our massages were excellent. It was very low key and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Where do you vacation when you LIVE in Hawaii?”
Reviews.Author: NaturalStateMassage
Reviews.Content: When you already live in paradise, where do you go to vacation? We enjoy a combination of luxury and nature. That IS paradise to us. If you can combine the two, you have a winner! We found that, at "Golden Haven Hot Springs". A beautiful, unpretentious, quaint hotel located in a town to match. Calistoga, California. We treated ourselves to a combination of their natural Hot Springs mud bath, followed by a soak in the hot mineral bath, couples massage, and even facials. We wanted the full treatment and we got it! Their honestly isn't any better natural high on earth than during and after these treatments. Complete bliss. We stayed in our spa robes the rest of the night. We also enjoyed being able to swim in the pool and soak in the hot springs late into the evening at the hotel facilities. Calistoga offered many wonderful restaurant's including a mexican restaurant that knocked my socks off! Wish I could remember the name. And you are in the heart of Napa Valley here. Golden Haven recommended a must see, which is Castello di Amorosa. This is a HUGE, authentic castle that is a winery, located minutes away. The castle and the wine was amazing and we left with a few bottles to enjoy after our spa treatments. I highly recommend taking a loved one and checking into Golden Haven Hot Springs for a few days. It was a perfect way to end our mainland trip. Thank you Golden Haven! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “total ghetto spa!”
Reviews.Author: pers0n
Reviews.Content: The service desk attendant (turned out to be the manager!) was very rude (and trashy to top it off) from the moment we walked in the door. We were coming to Calistoga for a girl's spa get away, but ended up checking out early due to the poor service and the filthiness of the spa. The "mineral pool" felt like you were in a jail or juvinal hall and I was supposed to have a mineral bath and when the attendant pointed to this pit in the floor where the water could not even be changed! I would not even put a foot in. We were looking forward to walking into town for the evening, but it is located too far off the main road to be able to do so. Overall we had a terrible experience and I would stay anywhere but at Golden Haven just on the poor, rude and disrespectful service alone.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service on earth”
Reviews.Author: Sweetitalian70
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had the worst service on earth. We were scheduled for a girlfriends package that is advertised on their website. We were scheduled to have the Spa package first and then stay for the night. Upon check-in for the spa, the so-called manager had such poor customer service skills and bordered on trashy rudeness. The staff mis-represented having a male massuese for a male attendant in the mud bath area. I have no problem with a male massuese but thought it inappropriate to have a male re-entering the room while we were nude. The male would be coming into the mud / mineral bath room. We were not informed of this at check-in, totally mis-represented. The staff caliber was also on the low low end (very trashy). There were no locker rooms, your valuable are not locked up. I had visions of having to run after the male attendant while naked with mud all over me, pursing my stolen goods. The mineral bath looked like a dark dungy bacteria filled hole. The staff took us back 20 minutes late to our appontment and when we stated our realization about the male attendant, they refused to provide a women and tried to blame us for being late when we had arrived 30 minutes early to our appointment. They would not credit the mud/mineral bath since it was a package and we therefore left the motel. Now, we had no place to stay or a spa reservation. We did not care. We were not about to give our hard earned money to these people. In the end, we found Calistoga Spa Hot Springs. They have 4 large mineral pools, very good room pricing, excellent spa treaments and the best friendly and customer oriented staff. And the prices were so much better. Thank you Calistoga Spa Hot Springs. No thank you Golden Haven trash.

Reviews.Title: “wow....amazing retreat!!!”
Reviews.Author: jujubee780
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked this trip on a whim to get away before he started his new job and I before summer classes start. Neither one of us has been to the Napa area and we definitely have not been to a resort where you lay around in mud! =) We arrived around 11 in the morning after driving from SF, our room was ready when we arrived so we checked in. Since we booked last minute and were staying 2 days, the first day we just got a room (without any treatments) and the second we purchased the "ultimate getaway" package. The only room left was the cottage room so our rate was $150 and the second night @ $160 per person. Upon checking in, the woman who helped us was friendly and nice; very informative about the grounds and taught us how to adjust the water for a non-scalding temp. Our room was right in front of the pool area so we were able to look out to see how busy the pool and sun deck were before actually leaving our room; but we were also right in front of the 10 minute parking area so we heard every time someone parked and open/shut their car doors. Once in the room, the fiance headed to the complimentary water and the candy jar! Excellent choice of candies included gobbstoppers, twizzlers, taffy, etc. We decided to do some wine tasting around the area for the first day so we were out and about. The bed was comfy but was a bit too soft for my liking. Our TV was not working and once we told the lady at the front desk, she was prompt in fixing our problem. We had the mud bath and massage on the second day. The mud bath was interesting.....in a very good way but different from anything I've tried before. The mud is very hot like previous reviewers have said and the nice touch is that they allow you to take photos without being charged. If you do not have a camera, they can take a photo and you have the option to buy or not. The hose really did help with rinsing the mud off, and the whirlpool tub definitely added to the cleaning process. After that, we were shuffled out of the mud room and into the blanket wrap...I almost fell asleep. My massage was absolutely fabulous! It was my first massage and the masseuse definitely put me at ease with her gentle touch and it was helpful that she was describing what steps she were planning to take. My skin was so smooth after and I just felt like a noodle. Luckily, we had our room just steps away so we both went back to the room and took a nap. Overall, GH was very satisfying and we both agree that this would be a nice getaway for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mud Bath- You just gotta do it!”
Reviews.Author: artygal
Reviews.Content: First time for a mud bath. Was a little unsure about the whole idea of 'getting into a mud mixture other people have been in', but it was a blast! My husband and I have had many massages, but this was different. Soak in warm mud for about 10 min. (they 'clean' the mud tubs with 150* water in between clients), rinse in shower, soak in mineral hot tub for about 15 min, give you a clean robe, walk to the quiet room for a blanket wrap for about 15 min (hubby fell asleep), then our massage therapists came and walked us to the massage room. They worked on us both in the same room. It was the end of the day, and there is no way these massage therapists can give their all all day long, so we might not have had the *best* massages, but certainly relaxing.
